field_reports.description:
In the morning of 6 August, a massive attack by the armed forces began in the territory of the border districts of Kursk Region. 

More than 10 thousand residents of Kursk region, including about 3 thousand children, are located in 153 temporary accommodation points in 19 regions of Russia, the Ministry of Emergency Situations reported. Another 480 TAPs with a total capacity of more than 38 thousand people are in readiness to receive citizens.

170 thousand people were evacuated
field_reports.summary: RUS: Other - 08-2024 - Attack on the Kursk region  #2 (2024-08-15)

contacts.name: Katsiaryna Lialeka
contacts.title: Programme coordinator Delegation for Russia and Belarus

field_reports.description: In the morning of 6 August, a massive attack by the armed forces began in the territory of the border districts of Kursk Region. On 7 August, a state of emergency was introduced in Kursk Region. A missile threat was repeatedly declared on the territory of the region, and there were fatalities.
field_reports.summary: RUS: Other - 08-2024 - Attack on the Kursk region

results.name: RUS: Other - 08-2024 - Fighting in the Kursk region
results.summary: In the morning of 6 August, a massive attack by the armed forces began in the territory of the border districts of Kursk Region. On 7 August, a state of emergency was introduced in Kursk Region. A missile threat was repeatedly declared on the territory of the region, and there were fatalities. As of today, 14,000 thousand residents have been evacuated from the border areas of Kursk Region and 21 temporary accommodation points have been opened, where more than 2,000 thousand people have been accommodated. The number of temporary accommodation points is planned to increase to 25. The number of displaced people will continue to increase.

contacts.name: John Entwistle
contacts.title: Head of IFRC CCD for Russia and Belarus

field_reports.description:
05.04.2024 in the Orenburg region near the city of Orsk, floods have begun, which led to a dam break on the Ural River.

More than 6 thousand residential houses, 9 thousand household plots and 40 low-water bridges remain flooded in 87 settlements and 13 garden associations in the region. More than 4 thousand people were evacuated, including 885 children.

The Government has deployed temporary accommodation points for the population from flooded areas. The Federal Emergency Situation regime has been established.
field_reports.summary: RUS: Flood - 04-2024 - Flooding in the Orenburg region

results.name: RUS: Flood - 04-2024 - Flooding in the Orenburg region
results.summary:

field_reports.description: In some areas of the Belgorod region, shelling of border settlements became more frequent, therefore a centralized evacuation of the population was organized, and some people left dangerous areas on their own. The regional branch of the Russian Red Cross, in close cooperation with the Administration of the Belgorod region, provides assistance to all displaced persons, both those who are in the TAP and those who left the border areas independently.

results.name: RUS: Population Movement - 2023-06 - Belgorod region
results.summary: In some areas of the Belgorod region, shelling of border settlements became more frequent, therefore a centralized evacuation of the population was organized, and some people left dangerous areas on their own. The regional branch of the Russian Red Cross, in close cooperation with the Administration of the Belgorod region, provides assistance to all displaced persons, both those who are in the TAP and those who left the border areas independently.

field_reports.description:
According to EMERCOM, since April 25, the most difficult situation has been developing in the Ural Federal District. In the Sverdlovsk, Kurgan and Tyumen regions, as a result of the spread of fire in 25 settlements, more than 6 thousand buildings were damaged, including 802 residential buildings. In order to stabilize the situation, more than 2,000 people and more than 300 units were involved in the localization and extinguishing of natural fires. equipment, including 21 aircraft. The main efforts of the EMERCOM of Russia are focused on the protection of settlements.

According to Russian Red Cross,  in Sverdlovsk region only a total of 659 people, including 148 children, lost their houses.

results.name: RUS: Fire - 2023-04 - Wildfires

field_reports.description:
On November 25, a message was received about smoke and an explosion at the Listvyazhnaya coal mine in the Belovsky urban district of the Kemerovo region. The first reports of smoke at a depth of 250 m began to arrive at emergency services at about 9 am local time, at the same time the evacuation of the mine workers began. According to the regional government, at the time of the smoke, there were 285 people in the mine. Most of them were brought to the surface. Due to the high temperature and the danger of new explosions, rescue operations were stopped. 52 people remained underground, including 6 mine rescuers. A government spokesman announced that they should be presumed dead.
In terms of the number of victims, this emergency will become the largest in Russian mines over the past 11 years.
field_reports.summary: Methane explosion at a coal mine in Belovo

results.name: Methane explosion at a coal mine in Belovo
